reference.text: preliminary treatment of ferrous ores or scrap C22B1/00; electric heating H05B

note.note-paragraph: This subclass covers: the production of iron or steel from source materials, e.g. the production of pig-iron; apparatus specially adapted therefor, e.g. blast furnaces or air heaters.
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

by applying additives, e.g. fluxing agents

reference.text: slag wool C03B; slag stones C04B

Heated electrically (plasma)

title-part.text: Making spongy iron or liquid steel, by direct processes

CPC-specific-text.text: obtaining iron or steel in a molten state
introduction of iron oxide into a bath of molten iron containing a carbon reductant
Reduction of iron ores by passing through a heated column of carbon
introduction of iron oxide in the flame of a burner or a hot gas stream
In fluidised bed furnaces or apparatus containing a dispersion of the material
in a continuous way by reduction from ores
making metallised agglomerates or iron oxide
On a massing grate
Starting from ores containing non ferrous metallic oxides
Preliminary conditioning of the solid carbonaceous reductant
Selection or treatment of the reducing gases
Use of special additives or fluxing agents
Conditioning, transformation of reduced iron ores
Protecting against oxidation

note.note-paragraph:
Group C21B13/02 is impacted by reclassification into group C21B13/029.
Groups C21B13/02 and C21B13/029 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

heated electrically

title-part.text: Handling of exhaust gases produced during the manufacture of iron or steel

note.note-paragraph:
Groups C21B2100/02 - C21B2100/06 are no longer used for the classification of documents as of 2017-05-01. The content of these groups is being reclassified into groups C21B2100/20 - C21B2100/80.
Groups C21B2100/02 - C21B2100/06 and C21B2100/20 - C21B2100/80 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: Energy from waste gases used in other processes
Increasing the gas reduction potential of recycled exhaust gases

note.note-paragraph:
Groups C21B2100/20 - C21B2100/284 are incomplete pending reclassification of documents from groups C21B2100/02 - C21B2100/06.
Groups C21B2100/02 - C21B2100/06 and C21B2100/20 - C21B2100/284 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: by adding additional fuel in recirculation pipes
Gas purification of exhaust gases to be recirculated or used in other metallurgical processes

note.note-paragraph:
Groups C21B2100/40 - C21B2100/44 are incomplete pending reclassification of documents from groups C21B2100/02 - C21B2100/06.
Groups C21B2100/02 - C21B2100/06 and C21B2100/40 - C21B2100/44 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: Removing particles, e.g. by scrubbing, dedusting
Process control or energy utilisation in the manufacture of iron or steel

note.note-paragraph:
Groups C21B2100/60 - C21B2100/66 are incomplete pending reclassification of documents from groups C21B2100/02 - C21B2100/06.
Groups C21B2100/02 - C21B2100/06 and C21B2100/60 - C21B2100/66 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: Energy conversion other than by heat exchange, e.g. by use of exhaust gas in energy production
Controlling the physical properties of the gas, e.g. pressure or temperature
Interaction of exhaust gases produced during the manufacture of iron or steel with other processes

note.note-paragraph:
Group C21B2100/80 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from groups C21B2100/02 - C21B2100/06.
Groups C21B2100/02 - C21B2100/06 and C21B2100/80 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: Particular sequence of the process steps
Modeling of the process, e.g. for control purposes
Treatment of slags originating from iron or steel processes
Physical or chemical treatment of slags
Methods of cooling or quenching molten slag
with the direct use of steam or liquid coolants, e.g. water
using air, inert gases or removable conductive bodies
with the permanent addition of cooled slag or other solids
Separating slag from liquid, e.g. from water, after quenching
Stirring or agitating by pressurised fluids or by moving apparatus
Specific shape of slag after cooling
Briquettes or moulded bodies other than sheets
Disc-shaped or conical parts for cooling, dispersing or atomising of molten slag rotating along vertical axis
Drums whereby slag is poured on or in between
Rotating beds on which slag is cooled
Conveyors on which slag is cooled
Jet nozzles or pressurised fluids for cooling, fragmenting or atomising slag
Receptacle features where the slag is treated
with a sealed or controlled environment
Tanks to collect the slag, e.g. water tank
Tower structures for cooling, being confined but not sealed
